author: Daily Mail Australia Reporter
title: MAFS's Christie Jordee flashes cleavage in flag swimsuit | Daily Mail Online
text: 255 shares 'This is typical summer me,' she wrote in the photo's caption. 'Always smiling when the sun is out, close to the water never in it,' she joked as she perched on the edge of a swimming pool. She wore her long black hair pulled back into a high ponytail and designer shades to shield her eyes from the sun. She included a branded Team iBlends water bottle with in the shot, endorsing the popular social media diet tea. Mismatch? She exchanged vows with Mark Hughes on Married At First Sight's second season and recently remarked she could 'do better' than the show's relationship experts The reality TV star also voiced her opinion on Married At First Sight's new season the same day on social media, singling out mature couple Deborah and Join in particular. 'I think they are both really sweet but not a match. I could do better than these experts,' she declared under a post of the pair on the show's Instagram account. 'If you believe what's on TV you're being na√Øve,' she added in a response to another fan's comment. 'All smoke and mirrors hun, whatever makes good TV,' she added. New chapter: The brunette beauty appears to be enjoying life since breaking up with her matched other half in June last year Dubious: The reality TV star also voiced her opinion on Married At First Sight's new season the same day on social media, singling out mature couple Deborah and Join in particular Christie exchanged vows with Mark while filming the popular Channel Nine late 2015. The handsome duo decided to call it quits just two months after viewers watched them get married in front of Sydney Opera House. Mark told Woman's Day of the split, 'We couldn't get into the relationship because we'd see each other once a week, but then not the next.' 'I felt like we were holding back because we knew we'd get hurt,' he continued. Finale: The handsome duo decided to call it quits just two months after viewers watched them get married in front of Sydney Opera House Read more: Share or comment on this article 255
